content: hood tie off flip the hood so that the right side is facing out your hooded blanket is now complete time to start adding the edging and horns front rhino horns for the big rhino horn on the front of the hood chain 12 and join to hood w/ form a ring leave a long tail about a foot at the beginning of your horns & chain to attach the horn to the blanket later spikes round 1 - sc1 into each chain round 2 - single_crochet into first 11 stitches skip last stitch and continue with next round round 3 - single_crochet into first 10 stitches skip last stitch and continue with next round round 4 and all remaining single_crochet until you reach the last stitch in the round skip that stitch and continue with the next round when there are only 3 stitches left in the round tie off and work the end into the horn for the small rhino horn work as above but start with a chain of 9 instead of 12 back spikes mark the first stitch in each round you re crocheting in a spiral so it is easy to lose your place if you don t mark the first stitch i usually just hang a paperclip on my first stitch as a marker round 1 - make a double ring see http //www crochetspot com/how-to-crochet-adjustable-double- ring/ and sc6 in the loop pull tight round 2 - single_crochet around the ring 6 single_crochet round 3 - 2 single_crochet in first stitch 1 single_crochet in next stitch - repeat around 9 single_crochet round 4 single_crochet in each stitch round 5 - 2 single_crochet in first stitch 1 single_crochet in next stitch - repeat around 14 single_crochet round 6 and 7 - single_crochet around round 8 - single_crochet in 1st and 2nd stitches sc2 in third - repeat around 18 single_crochet round 9-11 - single_crochet around tie off leaving at least a foot or so of yarn to sew the spikes to the blanket for a 2 foot blanket make 9 spikes of this size for the first and last two spikes on the back of the blanket stop after round 7 make 3 spikes of this size for the even smaller spikes on the front of the hood for the upper small spike stop after round 4 make 1 of this size for the lower smallest spike you will crochet directly onto the blanket see attach spikes and horns to blanket below attach spikes and horns to blanket stuff the big rhino horn with batting/fabric scraps before attaching pin the horn to the front of the hood along the center line near the edge of the hood you can use the corner fans as your guide for the center line use a tapestry needle to sew on the horn using the tail as thread skip about 2/3 inch then attach the smaller rhino horn above the big horn hood w/ stuffing not needed horns &
